author: VNExplorer
title: Timeline: Strong-to-severe thunderstorms could bring flooding, gusty winds to Chicago area
text: The Chicago area could see more showers and thunderstorms on Thursday, with a chance of severe weather looming in the forecast. According to the Storm Prediction Center, the area remains at a â€œmarginalâ€ risk of severe storms, with a few different threats possible as the day moves along. Hereâ€™s what we know about when those storms could arrive, and what they could bring to the region. Thursday Afternoon Thursday afternoon will see widely-scattered showers and thunderstorms across the area, and while no sustained severe weather is expected during that time, there is still a chance for some gusty winds and flooding in some locations, with heavy rain possible. Thursday Evening According to the NBC 5 Storm Team, the greater threat for severe storms could come in the evening hours, especially in areas north of Interstate 88, though storms could develop throughout the Chicago area. According to the SPCâ€™s guidance, the main threats will be gusty winds, which could exceed 60 miles per hour, and a risk of flash flooding due to anticipated heavy rain. There is also a low risk for damaging hail of up to an inch in diameter, and a non-zero risk of tornadoes, especially in counties north of Chicago. Those storms are expected to push out of the area by the late evening hours and into Friday morning, but more could arrive in fairly short order. Friday The low-pressure system that could bring showers and storms to the area Thursday will park itself over Lake Michigan for a short period of time Friday morning, and could generate more showers and storms during the morning. That system could also generate winds off of Lake Michigan that will bring cooler temperatures to the region on Friday, with highs only in the upper-70s or low-80s to begin the weekend. Saturday/Sunday While areas near the lake will remain cool over the weekend, with highs in the low-80s, the rest of the region will see temperatures rise back into the mid-to-upper 80s before another chance of a cool down arrives next week. More importantly, dry conditions are expected for the weekend, a welcome sight for those going to Lollapalooza and other significant events.

author: James Egan
title: 10 Video Game Remakes NO ONE Asked For
text:
10 Video Game Remakes NO ONE Asked For
Do you want an Until Dawn remake? No? Well, here it is anyway.
Many factors have to be taken into consideration before remaking a video game. How can the property be updated while still maintaining the essence of the original? What elements can be improved upon? Can modern technology be implemented to enhance the gaming experience?
Of course, the most important question to ask is also the simplest - Is the demand still there? Square knew Final Fantasy VII Remake would sell like crazy, since the fanbase have been begging for a reboot for decades. When Resident Evil 2 Remake topped the charts, Capcom got to work on redoing the follow-ups, since interest in the zombie saga peaked.
However, there are times when a publisher or development team decide to give an RPG, platformer, or a shooter a do-over, despite the fact nobody asked for it. When a title is still available on last-gen systems, it comes across as greedy to retool it for the latest console with the mildest tweaks. If the game in question is terrible or if the IP has been dead in the water for years, bringing it back rarely bodes well.
With that in mind, it's bewildering why these ten remakes got the thumbs up when it was crystal clear that nobody wanted them.
10. GoldenEye 007
It's hard to comprehend how impactful GoldenEye 007 was. Thanks to its accessible controls, mission-based gameplay, perfect soundtrack, flawlessly structured levels, and masterful multiplayer, it revolutionised the first-person shooters and proved movie tie-in games could be top-quality. (It also made everyone develop an unbridled hatred for Oddjob.) As a result, Bond enthusiasts were giddy with excitement upon learning GoldenEye 007 was being remade.
Sadly, that elation turned to confusion when it became apparent 2010's GoldenEye 007 was a remake in name only. Daniel Craig was portraying James Bond in the films at the time, so it was decided the martini-guzzling secret agent would be modelled off him instead of Pierce Brosnan.
To further emulate the modern Bond era, this revision removed the banter with Q and Moneypenny prior to missions, since the characters hadn't appeared in the on-screen reboot at the time. Bond's relationship with the main villain, Alec Trevelyan, was completely rewritten, distancing the plot from the source material once again.
Anyone intending to give this GoldenEye 007 a go purely to scratch that nostalgic itch were shocked to learn the levels had been redesigned from the ground up. Basically, the reboot had little resemblance to its N64 counterpart.
Ironically, the game itself was pretty solid. But it was so divorced from what came before, it seemed disingenuous to call it a GoldenEye 007 remake.

author: Max Lonzanida
title: NWS Yorktown recognizes Sailors and Civilians who served as part of the Incident Management Team during HURREX-CG2024 [Image 2 of 12]
text:
Yorktown, Va. (June 21, 2024) Captain Dan Patrick, Commanding Officer, Naval Weapons Station Yorktown presents a letter of recognition to YNC Angela Talarico who served as part of the installationâ€™s Incident Management Team (IMT) during exercise HURREX-CG2024 earlier this year. Hurricane Exercise (HURREX) and Citadel Gale (CG) are annual exercises conducted in mid-spring in preparation for the Atlantic hurricane season. The exercises provide focused hurricane preparation, recovery, consequence management and personnel account procedures training for afloat and shore-based East Coast and Gulf Coast commands. The exercises also focus on installation response and recovery to hurricane preparation, hurricane recovery and Navy family support. (U.S. Navy Photo by Max Lonzanda/Released).

author: The Hindu Bureau
title: Tearful farewell to BRS MLA Lasya Nanditha - The Hindu
text:
At 7.30 p.m., as the flames started rising from the funeral pyre of BRS MLA Lasya Nanditha, there was a chilling calm. The family members watched in hushed silence holding each otherâ€™s hands at the East Marredpallyâ€™s Smashana Vatika, located about four km from her residence in Karkhanaâ€™s Gruhalakshmi Colony, Secunderabad.
The silence was an arc of grief away from the inconsolable wailing that followed the news of Nandithaâ€™s death in a road accident. The families of neighbours and party workers shared the grief after her body was shifted to her residence, an upper-middle class neighbourhood in Karkhana, from the Gandhi Hospital after an autopsy at around 11 a.m., almost six hours after her demise on the city outskirts in Patancheru.
Through the day, political leaders led by Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy offered floral tributes condolences at the residence of the MLA.
Earlier, Former Chief Minister K. Chandrashekhar Rao along with other senior BRS leaders like Sabitha Indra Reddy visited the late SCB MLA Sayannaâ€™s residence to pay homage to Nanditha. Mr Rao spoke to her mother, and elder sister Niveditha and consoled them. The family members wailed inconsolably when BRS MLC Kalvakuntla Kavitha reached the family home.
â€œShe always greeted me with a smile even if she did not necessarily have to,â€ said one of the women standing by the crowd outside her residence.
Around afternoon, Chief Secretary A. Santhi Kumari issued orders and directed the Hyderabad District Collector and the Hyderabad Police Commissioner to make necessary arrangements in consultation with the family members.
COMMents

title: 'More aggressive and difficult to fight' : Oregon braces for dangerous fire season - NewsBreak
text:
Oregon
'More aggressive and difficult to fight' : Oregon braces for dangerous fire season
59 minutes ago
OREGON, USA â€” "More aggressive and difficult to control," those are the words from Oregon Gov. Tina Kotek to describe this upcoming wildfire season. It's expected to be just as bad, if not worse, than what Oregonians experienced last summer. One of the largest fire caches in the state...

author: IvÃ¡n Serrano Jauregui
title: Nubes UDG capta 2.2 millones de litros de agua al aÃ±o
text:
A un aÃ±o de su implementaciÃ³n, el programa de captaciÃ³n de agua de lluvia Nubes UDG de la Universidad de Guadalajara tiene 16 sedes intervenidas con este sistema de captaciÃ³n de agua de lluvia, mediante los cuales se captan 2 millones 200 mil litros de agua.
Se trata de implementaciones instaladas en 3 mil 018 metros cuadrados de superficie, que beneficia a 57 mil alumnos de los planteles:
- Centro Universitario de TonalÃ¡ (CUTonalÃ¡).
- Centro Universitario de Ciencias BiolÃ³gicas y Agropecuarias (
CUCBA).
- Centro Universitario de Ciencias Exactas e IngenierÃ­as (
CUCEI).
- Preparatoria 6.
- Preparatoria 18.
- Preparatoria 19.
- Preparatoria de Ciudad GuzmÃ¡n.
- Preparatoria de El Arenal.
- MÃ³dulo San AgustÃ­n.
- MÃ³dulo ConcepciÃ³n de Buenos Aires.
- MÃ³dulo Atequiza.
- MÃ³dulo TolimÃ¡n.
- MÃ³dulo MatatlÃ¡n.
- MÃ³dulo San Miguel Huaixtita.
- MÃ³dulo Ocota de la Sierra.
El profesor investigador del Departamento de Estudios del Agua y la EnergÃ­a del
CUTonalÃ¡, JesÃºs Barrera Rojas, mencionÃ³ que en dicho campus Nubes UDG apenas alberga 180 metros cuadrados (menos del 1 por ciento de la superficie del centro universitario), pero permite recabar 153 mil litros por temporada.
â€œPara saber cuÃ¡nta agua se quiere captar sÃ³lo se tendrÃ­a que investigar cuÃ¡l es la precipitaciÃ³n promedio en su localidad; aquÃ­, el Ãrea Metropolitana de Guadalajara (AMG) es de mÃ¡s o menos entre 850 y 1000 milÃ­metros por temporadaâ€.
â€œEntonces, si tenemos un metro cuadrado de superficie para captaciÃ³n sÃ³lo multiplicamos ese metro cuadrado por los milÃ­metros de agua y tendrÃ­amos los litros. Es decir, en un metro cuadrado tendrÃ­amos mil litrosâ€, mencionÃ³.
En el CUTonalÃ¡, ademÃ¡s de captarla, utilizan el agua para el consumo humano; esto mediante un sistema extra de desinfecciÃ³n, de filtrado y absorciÃ³n, y otro de desinfecciÃ³n mediante UV.
Belkis SulbarÃ¡n Rangel, profesora investigadora del CUTonalÃ¡, recalcÃ³ que â€œla captaciÃ³n de agua de lluvia es una soluciÃ³n viable que se puede tener desde nuestros hogares- Esto no es nuevo, pues se usa desde hace siglos en diferentes partes del mundo y reduce la dependencia de fuentes externas y las inundaciones; incluso, pueden traer beneficios econÃ³micos con ahorros a largo plazo para empresas y hogaresâ€.
RecordÃ³ que en el AMG hay una dependencia excesiva de fuentes como el Lago de Chapala, y eso hace que â€œla gestiÃ³n del agua dependa de las condiciones de lluvia de cada temporalâ€. Esa situaciÃ³n, aÃ±adiÃ³, se podrÃ­a contrarrestar si en mÃ¡s terrenos de la ciudad se pudiera captar el agua.
Proponen que sistemas de captaciÃ³n se incluyan en desarrollos urbano
Barrera Rojas indicÃ³ que es importante que este tipo de programas se difundan entre empresas y hogares para aprovechar la lluvia.
â€œHay polÃ­ticas pÃºblicas que se deberÃ­an implementar, como el que las instalaciones de nuevos desarrollos habitacionales; zonas industriales o de servicios deben de contar dentro de sus planos con sistemas de captaciÃ³n de agua de lluvia, ya sea para contenerla, almacenarla o para la infiltraciÃ³n y recarga de los mantos acuÃ­ferosâ€, indicÃ³.
Otra de las opciones es la implementaciÃ³n de jardines de lluvia, que consiste en una depresiÃ³n ajardinada para reconducir el agua superficial para infiltrarla y recargar el subsuelo; esto, dijeron, permitirÃ­a que se redujeran las inundaciones en zonas bajas de la ciudad.
AÃ­da LucÃ­a Fajardo Montiel, investigadora del CUTonalÃ¡, aÃ±adiÃ³ que segÃºn la OrganizaciÃ³n Mundial de la Salud (OMS) se requieren 100 litros de agua por dÃ­a para satisfacer las necesidades humanas.
â€œPero hay que considerar que de este total de agua casi 80 por ciento se convertirÃ¡ en agua residual, que podrÃ­a ir a plantas de tratamiento y esto nos darÃ­a la oportunidad de tratarla, procesarla y volverla a utilizar. Esta acciÃ³n tambiÃ©n serÃ­a importante para el cuidado del recurso hÃ­dricoâ€, declarÃ³.
Indicaron que los mayores desafÃ­os para implementar los sistemas de captaciÃ³n es la educaciÃ³n y concientizaciÃ³n, pero tambiÃ©n polÃ­ticas de apoyo y mayores incentivos para que las personas los implementen de manera voluntaria. Reconocieron el avance del programa estatal de Nidos de Lluvia UDG.
TambiÃ©n se necesita que exista mÃ¡s infraestructura urbana para instalar los sistemas que implican planeaciones urbanas, ingenierÃ­a civil y sostenibilidad urbana. Otro problema, dijeron, es que los sistemas pueden representar una fuerte inversiÃ³n por los costos iniciales; pero que al largo plazo los ahorros de agua serÃ¡n significativos.

author: Carmen HernÃ¡ndez
title: LÃ³pez Obrador, el presidente que mÃ¡s ha hecho por los trabajadores
text:
RÃO BLANCO, Ver., 7 de enero de 2024.- Por sus contribuciones a una polÃ­tica laboral de equidad y justicia, el gobernador CuitlÃ¡huac GarcÃ­a JimÃ©nez entregÃ³ al presidente AndrÃ©s Manuel LÃ³pez Obrador una rÃ©plica del Decreto del 19 de octubre de 1914 emitido por CÃ¡ndido Aguilar Vargas en el que promulgÃ³ la primera Ley que fijÃ³ el salario mÃ­nimo para Veracruz.
Al darle la bienvenida, en la exÂ¬fÃ¡brica de textil para conmemorar el 117 aniversario de los MÃ¡rtires de RÃ­o Blanco, expresÃ³ que es un autÃ©ntico honor la presencia del mejor Presidente de MÃ©xico, que mÃ¡s ha hecho por los derechos y reivindicaciones de los trabajadores.
El mandatario tambiÃ©n recordÃ³ a Heriberto Jara Corona, uno de los dirigentes y partÃ­cipe en la huelga de RÃ­o Blanco de 1907; como diputado constituyente impulsÃ³ la Ley 123 por la que los obreros de la industria textil redujeron sus horas de trabajo y la obtenciÃ³n de un salario mÃ­nimo.
Con la presencia de lÃ­deres sindicales, confederaciones, agrupaciones de empleados, trabajadores y campesinos, el Presidente anunciÃ³ una iniciativa de reforma al artÃ­culo 123 de la ConstituciÃ³n para que el salario mÃ­nimo estÃ© encima de la inflaciÃ³n y evitar la pÃ©rdida del poder adquisitivo.
â€œYa es una polÃ­tica laboral distinta, al carajo con el neoliberalismo, al carajo con el neoporfirismo, no queremos la oligarquÃ­a, MÃ©xico no es un paÃ­s de unos cuantos, es de todos los mexicanos, de todo el puebloâ€, afirmÃ³.
TambiÃ©n, se comprometiÃ³ a revisar la contrarreforma al sistema de pensiones del expresidente Ernesto Zedillo.
Â«Vamos a hacer una propuesta, porque es completamente inhumano e injusto que un trabajador, despuÃ©s de 30 aÃ±os de estar laborando ni siquiera recibe su salario cuando estaba en activo, sino la mitad, si le va bienâ€.
El secretario del Trabajo y PrevisiÃ³n Social, Marath BolaÃ±os LÃ³pez, enumerÃ³ los principales logros de la Cuarta TransformaciÃ³n que ponen a MÃ©xico como referente mundial: el aumento salarial, la Reforma Laboral, el nuevo modelo de conciliaciÃ³n, el programa JÃ³venes Construyendo el Futuro.
AdemÃ¡s de la eliminaciÃ³n de la subcontrataciÃ³n, recuperaciÃ³n del reparto de utilidades, reducciÃ³n de la tasa del desempleo, ampliaciÃ³n del periodo vacacional de 6 a 12 dÃ­as en el primer aÃ±o y actualizaciÃ³n de la tabla de enfermedades tras 52 aÃ±os de rezago.

author: PA News Agency
title: Thousands of homes remain without power in wake of Storm Gerrit | Lancashire Telegraph
text:
Thousands of homes remain without power as the post-storm cleanup begins in the wake of Storm Gerrit.
Around 1,500 homes in Scotland experienced their second night without power in Scotland while a lightning strike hit supplies in Wales on Thursday.
Power company Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks said it had restored supply to more than 46,000 properties that lost power due to the storm, with people in the north east and Shetland worst affected.
âš¡ We've now restored power to 46k customers #stormgerrit ðŸ  1.5k will be off overnight, we're giving help & advice.ðŸ‘· Teams are working tonight to clear debris hindering access to faults.â˜• Full details of vans serving hot meals from 9am tomorrow are at https://t.co/HSBcM400Fh pic.twitter.com/pnHIApyUvC
â€” Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (@ssencommunity) December 28, 2023
They said the remaining homes should be reconnected on Friday with welfare vans serving hot food and drink to affected customers from 9am.
Operations director Andy Smith said: â€œThis has been a difficult couple of days for the communities affected and Iâ€™m grateful to them for their patience and support as our teams work extremely hard to restore power.â€
National Grid UK said 36,000 properties were without power in Ceredigion on Thursday after lightning struck.
Storm Gerrit strongest gusts. See story WEATHER Gerrit. Infographic PA Graphics. An editable version of this graphic is available if required. Please contact graphics@pamediagroup.com. Three men died after their 4Ã—4 vehicle was submerged in the River Esk, near Glaisdale, on Thursday, North Yorkshire Police said.
A supercell thunderstorm moved across the northwest of England on Thursday after a similar storm is thought to have resulted in a tornado that damaged homes in Greater Manchester on Wednesday.
Around 100 properties were damaged by what police called a â€œlocalised tornadoâ€ in Stalybridge, Tameside and in the badly-hit village of Carrbrook.
Hayley McCaffer, 40, who lives in Carrbrook, told the PA news agency that some of her neighboursâ€™ houses â€œare an absolute disasterâ€ with missing roofs and â€œsquishedâ€ cars.
Damage will be covered by standard property insurance policies, the Association of British Insurers has said.
Screengrab taken from PA Video of a damaged gate in Stalybridge after the Tameside tornado (Richard McCarthy/PA) ScotRail said many lines have been reopened but urged passengers to check for the latest information before travelling, a message echoed by LNER, Avanti West Coast and London Northwestern Railway who suspensed or cancelled services due to damage or system faults.
Friday will see significant disruption for travellers wishing to travel on the London Euston and Watford Junction lines with services expected to be up and running by the end of the day.
In Wales, the aftermath of the recent severe weather will see rail services hampered until Monday.
ðŸŒ¦ï¸ Blustery showers are possible on Friday morning, with these most likely in the north and west. Many of us will also see some sunshine and some places may stay dry.
ðŸŒ¬ï¸ Still windy in northern England and later Shetland, with gales possible, but otherwise somewhat less windy. pic.twitter.com/hInP8LNF2c
â€” Met Office (@metoffice) December 28, 2023
Ferry services also experienced cancellations and delays due to storm activity with operator DFDS confirming sailings between Dover and France were delayed due to strong winds in the English Channel.
Air travel in and out of the UK saw cancellations but most services have returned to normal.
The Met Office reported the worst of Storm Gerrit had passed with the last few days of 2023 forecast to be unsettled with strong winds, rain and even snow on higher ground.
Met Office chief forecaster Steven Ramsdale said: â€œHeavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday, affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit. However, this rainfall will be a step down from that seen during Storm Gerrit.â€

La UniÃ³n EspaÃ±ola de Cooperativas de EnseÃ±anza (UECoE) y el Grupo Cooperativo Cajamar han dado a conocer los ganadores de la octava ediciÃ³n de los premios del concurso "Emprendemos. Fomento del emprendimiento cooperativo en la escuela". De esta manera, en la modalidad A, dedicada a la "Mejor iniciativa emprendedora desde centro no cooperativo", el premio, dotado con 2.000 euros, ha sido para el IES La Melva de Elda en Alicante, por el proyecto "Farmahogar".
Este proyecto propone la creaciÃ³n de una cooperativa social orientada a ofrecer servicios de atenciÃ³n farmacÃ©utica y acompaÃ±amiento domiciliario a personas mayores, dependientes, con movilidad reducida o en situaciÃ³n de soledad. Esta necesidad se ha hecho aÃºn mÃ¡s visible tras la pandemia del Covid y desastres naturales como la DANA, sufrida en la Comunidad Valenciana, dejando una huella emocional profunda, especialmente en las personas mayores, muchas de las cuales ahora sufren miedo a salir de casa o han perdido redes de apoyo.
Por su parte, el colegio MendiÃ±o, cooperativa de enseÃ±anza gallega de Vigo en Pontevedra, ha obtenido el premio en la modalidad A, dedicada a la "Mejor iniciativa emprendedora desde centro cooperativo", por el proyecto "Opportunity", dotado con 2.000 euros. Este proyecto nace de la idea de proporcionar empleo, buscando conectar directamente la oferta y la demanda de trabajo en el sector pesquero, facilitando procesos de contrataciÃ³n justos y eficientes entre armadores y poblaciÃ³n migrante para cubrir la demanda en el sector pesquero de relevo generacional, y ofreciendo beneficios econÃ³micos, sociales y empresariales a la regiÃ³n.
Por Ãºltimo, en la Modalidad B, dedicada al mejor "Proyecto a travÃ©s de cooperativa escolar", dotado con 1.000 euros para la adquisiciÃ³n de material educativo o informÃ¡tico que favorezca la labor de los docentes y el desarrollo del alumnado de esta cooperativa educativa, el premio ha sido concedido al colegio Reina Sofia de Totana en Murcia, por el trabajo "Abuelos 2.0". El proyecto plantea la creaciÃ³n de una Cooperativa escolar cuyo objetivo es conectar a los jÃ³venes con los mayores a travÃ©s de la tecnologÃ­a para que no se queden atrÃ¡s en el mundo digital, que se comuniquen mejor con su familia, que encuentren informaciÃ³n Ãºtil en internet, que puedan realizar trÃ¡mites online y que se diviertan con las cosas que ofrece la tecnologÃ­a.
AdemÃ¡s de estos tres premiados, los miembros del jurado han acordado otorgar una MenciÃ³n Especial en cada una de las modalidades a los proyectos "KilÃ³metros de Salud", realizado por el alumnado del Colegio Valle del Miro de Valdemoro en Madrid, y al "Voluntariado Intergeneracional: TÃº y yo", del alumnado del Colegio Cipriano Galea de La Ã‘ora en Murcia, por su calidad, por su valor educativo, originalidad y sostenibilidad social y econÃ³mica.

El objeto del concurso, en el que han participado estudiantes de ESO y FP en representaciÃ³n de centros educativos de todo el paÃ­s, ha sido fomentar la cultura emprendedora entre los escolares, compartir los principios y valores que identifican al cooperativismo y a la economÃ­a social espaÃ±ola, y dar visibilidad y reconocimiento a los proyectos que vienen desarrollando las cooperativas de enseÃ±anza y el resto de los centros escolares para impulsar el espÃ­ritu empresarial.
